definition: to let go/to cast/to let loose/to discharge/to give expression to
lit. the wind cannot be caught in a net/to waste one's effort (idiom)

sentences.english: He always focused on his trading, but he also cast a wider net and caught other kinds of fish.
sentences.chinese: 他总是关注自己的交易，但有时会去撒网捕鱼。

sentences.english: The wind cannot be caught in a net.
The fisherman cast the net and caught an oarfish .
sentences.chinese: 渔夫撒网捕上一条浆鱼。

sentences.english: Catch the wind with a net.
They seek not for hidden treasures, They know not how to cast nets.
sentences.chinese: 他们不寻找宝藏，他们不知该如何撒网。

sentences.english: It is better to be extensive in fewer social networks than to spread yourself thin.
sentences.chinese: 集中在少数几个网站进行营销推广比到处撒网要好。

sentences.english: Girls like fishing, should be comprehensive, focus on training.
sentences.chinese: 泡妞就像钓鱼，要全面撒网，重点培养。

sentences.english: The wind cannot be caught in net.
This time Peter and his brother Andrew were working by casting a net into the lake. Fishing.
sentences.chinese: 这次彼得和他的兄弟安得烈在加利利湖撒网捕鱼。

sentences.english: We drifted again and made up the number of 15 salmon.
sentences.chinese: 我们又顺流撒网，共捕到15条鲑鱼。

sentences.english: Suppose a net has been cast into a lake to catch fish.
sentences.chinese: 假如在一个湖上撒网捕鱼。

sentences.english: Once in my net I snared the daughter of a King.
sentences.chinese: 一次我撒网捕到了国王的女儿。

sentences.english: From there they cast nets into the surf or motor farther out to sea.
sentences.chinese: 他们在那里撒网捕鱼或驾机动船出海。

definition: variant of 漁網|渔网[yu2 wang3]
use a long line to catch a big fish (idiom); a long-term plan for major returns
pinyin: fang4 chang2 xian4 diao4 da4 yu2

definition: to fish with a hook and bait
to fish (with line and hook)/to dupe
lit. to guard a tree-stump, waiting for rabbits (idiom)/to wait idly for opportunities/to trust to chance rather than show initiative
variant of 漁汛|渔汛[yu2 xun4]
